citeinfo.title: El Ni￱o Winners and Losers - Alaska Sea Grant Radio Show

descript.abstract: This winter's El Ni￱o weather pattern has sent storm after storm into the U.S West Coast and brought heavy snows to New England states. The weather phenomenon also is influencing a warmer-than-normal winter as far north as Alaska. And as Doug Schneider reports in this week's Arctic Science Journeys Radio, the North Pacific's latest El Ni￱o may have important long-term impacts on Alaska's commercial fisheries.
descript.purpose: Six months ago, when scientists first noticed ocean temperatures rising in the equatorial South Pacific Ocean, they predicted the United States would experience a mild El Ni￱o in the coming winter. As winter approached, the periodic phenomenon that alters weather patterns sent a string of storms surging into California, Oregon and Washingtonﾗstorms that have dumped heavy snows as far east as the New England states.
